result.execSummary:
The defendant Julio E Mora was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Julio E Mora is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Julio E Mora was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: State agrees to termination of probation after 2 yrs provided PO agent agrees in writing and def has completed all conditions of probation & commits no new crimes rising to the level of probable cause and has no ATR's or revocations while on probation.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $368  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with LEB without the PO agent's written permissiong & the victim agrees to the contact in writing.

Completion of aggression/anger management treatment.  Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
